--- title: "Scientific Writing" description: | Scientific Writing: Focussing on the "tricks" date: 04-18-2024 author: - name: SGH PT Dept categories: - research - writing image: 'write.jpg' --- ### Disclaimer - Jacqueline provides the *tips*; Yonghao provides the *tricks*. - Take the tips seriously. Tricks, with a pinch of salt. ### Overview $$ \begin{array}{rl} \text{Good Scientific Writing} &= \text{Good Science} + \text{Good Writing} \\ \text{Good Writing} &= \text{Good English Grammar, Usage, and Style } \\ \text{Good Writing} &= \beta_0 + \beta_1\text{ Reading (See)} + \beta_2\text{ Practice (Do)} + \beta_3\text{ Criticism (Feedback)} \text{, where}\\ \beta_0 &= \text {Baseline level of writing skills} \\ \end{array} $$ [See-Do-Feedback](https://www.scotthyoung.com/blog/2022/04/21/see-do-feedback/) are the components of effective practice ::: {.column-margin} When a speaker prefers equations to essays, take his "advice" with a pinch of salt! ::: ### Reading ::: {.panel-tabset} ### Trick 1: Read widely * Elliott E, Baur L, Keena V. [Scientific Writing: Easy When You Know How](https://image.sciencenet.cn/olddata/kexue.com.cn/upload/blog/file/2010/11/2010111022210817101.pdf). BMJ Books, London. 2002. * Gopen GD, Swan JA. [The science of scientific writing](https://www.americanscientist.org/blog/the-long-view/the-science-of-scientific-writing). Am. Sci. 1990; 78: 550–8. * Journals with (usually) very well-written articles + [Annals of Internal Medicine](https://www.acpjournals.org/journal/aim) + [Anesthesia analgesia](https://journals.lww.com/anesthesia-analgesia/pages/default.aspx) + [BMJ](https://www.bmj.com/content/383/bmj-2023-077143) + [Circulation](https://www.ahajournals.org/journal/circ) + [Chest](https://journal.chestnet.org/) ### Trick 2: Seek widely * Analogous field thinking: seek solutions from subject areas that seem different on the surface but similar on a deep structural level * [Sometimes the best ideas come from outside your industry](https://hbr.org/2014/11/sometimes-the-best-ideas-come-from-outside-your-industry) HBR 2014 * Example: [Discordance Paper](https://www.arthroplastyjournal.org/article/S0883-5403(23)00264-4/abstract) + Discordance between self-reported and performance-based measures of physical disability in people with knee osteoarthritis + Discordance between total cholesterol to HDL ratio in comparison with LDL cholesterol and non-HDL cholesterol (Ref 20) ::: ### Practice ::: {.panel-tabset} ### Trick 3: Create standalone Tables ::: {.cell .column-page} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![Informative Table Caption](cload.jpg){width=900px} ::: ::: ::: {.column-margin} Table taken from [Pandharipande et al](https://www.nejm.org/doi/full/10.1056/NEJMoa1301372) ::: ### Trick 4: Create standalone Figures ::: {.cell .column-page} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![Informative Figure Caption](fig_cload.png){width=900px} ::: ::: ::: {.column-margin} Figure taken from [Wanderer et al](https://journals.lww.com/anesthesia-analgesia/fulltext/2015/04000/supervising_anesthesiologists_cannot_be.32.aspx) ::: ::: ### Criticism - Feedback from fellow co-authors can sometimes be too soft and congratulatory to cut deep at what works and what doesn't work in your writing. ::: {.callout-tip} # Trick 5 Pluck up your courage and email authors whom you admire[^1]! ::: [^1]: Be [thick-skinned](https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/how-thicker-can-give-you-advantage-lifes-battles-larae-quy/) and don't be `Paiseh` ::: {.panel-tabset} ### Author 1 * (the late) [Professor John Ludbrook](https://www.surgeons.org/en/about-racs/about-the-college-of-surgeons/in-memoriam/obituaries/john-ludbrook) + [Writing intelligible English prose for biomedical journals](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/17439423/) Clin Exp Pharmacol Physiol . 2007 May-Jun;34(5-6):508-14. ### Author 2 * [Dr. Berend Terluin](https://researchinformation.amsterdamumc.org/en/persons/berend-terluin) ::: {.cell .column-page} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![Writing Tips](terluin.png){width=900px} ::: ::: ::: ### Summary * The rhetoric of research is often about fun and creativity but the reality is that research (including scientific writing) can be taxing and uncomfortable. ::: {.callout-note .column-page collapse="true"} ## Trick 6 > The trick is not minding that the process is hard. Taken from [Scott Young](https://www.scotthyoung.com/blog/2023/09/26/10x-rule-ambitious-goals/) In a scene in Lawrence of Arabia, the titular T. E. Lawrence lights a cigarette and puts out the match by rubbing it between his fingers. Shortly after, another man attempts the same trick:
Man: Oh! [burning his fingers] It damn well hurts! Lawrence: Certainly it does. Man: Well what’s the trick then? Lawrence: The trick, William Potter, is not minding that it hurts.
:::
